description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
author: Bessel van der Kolk

description: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.
title: BRAIDING SWEETGRASS
author: Robin Wall Kimmerer

description: A civil rights lawyer and MacArthur grant recipient’s memoir of his decades of work to free innocent people condemned to death.
title: JUST MERCY
author: Bryan Stevenson

description: A memoir about growing up biracial in apartheid South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.”
title: BORN A CRIME
author: Trevor Noah

description: The late feminist icon explores the causes of a polarized society and the meaning of love.
title: ALL ABOUT LOVE
author: bell hooks

description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.
title: EDUCATED
author: Tara Westover

description: A look at arbitrary beliefs surrounding opium, caffeine and mescaline, which are derived from plants.
title: THIS IS YOUR MIND ON PLANTS
author: Michael Pollan

description: Famous examples of miscommunication serve as the backdrop to explain potential conflicts and misunderstandings.
title: TALKING TO STRANGERS
author: Malcolm Gladwell

description: A look at the key players and outcomes of precision bombing during World War II.
title: THE BOMBER MAFIA
author: Malcolm Gladwell

description: Unexpected factors that explain why some people succeed, such as upbringing, timing and 10,000 hours of deliberate practice.
title: OUTLIERS
author: Malcolm Gladwell

description: When we can and cannot trust our intuitions in making business and personal decisions.
title: THINKING, FAST AND SLOW
author: Daniel Kahneman

description: The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil. The fledgling F.B.I. intervened, ineffectively.
title: KILLERS OF THE FLOWER MOON
author: David Grann

description: The author recalls how she and her siblings were constantly moved from one bleak place to another.
title: THE GLASS CASTLE
author: Jeannette Walls

description: A story of how an architect and a serial killer were linked by the Chicago World's Fair of 1893.
title: THE DEVIL IN THE WHITE CITY
author: Erik Larson

description: The surgeon and New Yorker writer considers how doctors fail patients at the end of life, and how they can do better.
title: BEING MORTAL
author: Atul Gawande
